properties.description: The Springfield Food Pantry offers fresh and nutritious food for an affordable weekly membership fee, whilst making good use of quality food which would otherwise go to waste. The Food Pantry is a community-led scheme open to anyone to join, not just those in crisis. With rising food costs, the Pantry offers choice and dignity during tough times. You can become a member of The Springfield Food Pantry for a weekly subscription of just £5. For this you get to choose at least 10 items of food worth about £15, including fresh fruit and vegetables, meat and store cupboard favourites. Members can also get involved in volunteering and training, placing local people at the heart of decision-making about food. The Springfield Food Pantry is open every Monday from 11am to 2:30pm at St Edmund’s Church, Reddings Lane, Tyseley B11 3DD. The 41 bus runs every half an hour between The Springfield Centre and The Food Pantry.
properties.title: Local Pantry

properties.description: NAF CAF is a pay-as-you-feel cafe providing hot healthy food, tea, coffee and soft drinks and free arts workshops each week. The cafe is family friendly and open to all. Food is served from 5pm, arts workshops are available all night and most weeks we run a choir from 6-7pm which all are welcome to join no matter their abilities. NAF CAF is a welcoming community of people who come together to socialise, meet new people and eat together. The cafe also collects surplus food from Aldi in Northfield each week that anyone who attends can take items from. From 4-5pm each person who comes along can take 3 items and after 5pm, anyone is welcome to take whatever else they may need. Bring your own carrier bags, there's always lots of fresh vegetables and shelf stables too.

properties.description: Place of Welcome” is the flagship of our Community Services. Typically attended by over 40 people each week, it is a much valued resource in the Sparkhill community for local people to come together for fellowship, food and social activities including cooking, knitting, crochet, board games and pool. Place of Welcome The Springfield Project New Day, New Venue! From Wednesday 13 September, Place of Welcome will be held every Wednesday during term time at a temporary alternative venue at 1.30-3pm at Hall Green United Church, 609 Reddings Ln, Birmingham B28 8TE. The cooking group will be meeting at 12.30-2pm. We look forward to seeing you then. Contact us on 0121 777 2722 or email info@springfieldproject.org.uk with any questions. Everyone is welcome and a free hot meal is served at 2pm. We are proud to be a part of the national Warm Welcome scheme. Local people come to Place of Welcome for free hot refreshments, information and support, to take part in social activities and connect with other people. The cooking group meets each Wednesday at 12.30 to prepare and cook the hot meal together. If you would like to join this friendly group, then come to the Hall Green United Church at 12.30pm. Ingredients are provided and no experience is necessary. We welcome your ideas for recipes to try – we have enjoyed inspiring meals from all over the world. There is currently money and benefit advice, adult social care advice provided.
